alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:46PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Custer County through 815 PM CDT... At 745 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Weissert, or 17 miles east of Broken Bow, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Westerville, Arcadia Diversion Dam State Wildlife Management Area and Wescott. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 96 and 103. Highway 92 between mile markers 306 and 308. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for central Nebraska.
